intro: Guatteria eugeniifolia, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen or Guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
